intro: Astracantha carthlica, commonly known as the horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes other well-known species like the common poppy. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, spiky seed pods that resemble horns, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically bright red or orange, with a prominent central stigma. Astracantha carthlica is often found in rocky or arid habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
